sub_topic: Finding the area of a sector of a circle.
message_1: A circle has a radius of 6 cm. Find the area of a sector of the circle if the central angle of the sector is 60 degrees.
message_2:
To find the area of a sector of a circle, we can use the formula:

Area of sector = (Central angle / 360) × π × r²

where r is the radius of the circle and the central angle is given in degrees.

In this problem, the radius (r) is 6 cm and the central angle is 60 degrees. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Area of sector = (60 / 360) × π × 6²

Area of sector = (1/6) × π × 36

Area of sector = 6π cm²

So, the area of the sector is 6π square centimeters.
